metadata.description: CVE-2025-55182, also known as React2Shell, is a critical unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability in the React Server Components (RSC) Flight protocol. Vulnerable versions of the react-server-dom-webpack, react-server-dom-parcel and react-server-dom-turbopack packages unsafely deserialize attacker-controlled Flight payloads for Server Function endpoints. A single crafted HTTP request can manipulate React chunks via colon-path resolution and trigger execution of attacker-controlled JavaScript on the server. CVE-2025-66478 for Next.js has been rejected as a duplicate identifier; detections for that CVE are covered by this module.
metadata.recommendation:
Immediately upgrade all React Server Components and framework dependencies to fixed versions. At minimum, update the RSC packages to 19.0.1, 19.1.2 or 19.2.1 or later, and apply the latest security releases of frameworks that implement React Server Components (for example, Next.js App Router, React Router RSC, Waku and others). For Next.js applications, follow the official guidance and mitigation scripts such as npx fix-react2shell-next where applicable. If you cannot patch right away, consider temporarily disabling React Server Components or experimental App Router features, restricting access to RSC endpoints, and monitoring for suspicious multipart/form-data Flight requests.

  • Inventory applications that use React Server Components or Next.js App Router.
  • Patch or rebuild affected services with fixed React versions.
  • Harden exposure of RSC endpoints using authentication and network controls.
  • Monitor for exploitation patterns and post-exploitation malware associated with this CVE.

attacks.name: React2Shell safe Flight crash probe (Assetnote pattern)

metadata.description: Sends a crafted React Flight multipart/form-data payload that triggers a deterministic server-side error in vulnerable React Server Components / Next.js implementations without executing operating system commands. Detection relies on the characteristic 500 response with a text/x-component Flight stream that includes an E{\"digest\"} error chunk.
metadata.notes: This probe is designed as a safe detection mechanism. It may cause 500 Internal Server Error responses and log entries on vulnerable endpoints but does not attempt to run shell commands or modify server state.

props.name: request.body.text
props.value:
------WebKitFormBoundary%%random%%
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="1"

{}
------WebKitFormBoundary%%random%%
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="0"

["$1:a:a"]
------WebKitFormBoundary%%random%%--

attacks.name: React2Shell safe Flight crash probe (alternate variant)

metadata.description: An alternate variant of the React2Shell safe probe that uses different header values and a fixed multipart boundary. This helps evade naive signature-based blocking while still triggering the same deterministic error pattern in vulnerable implementations.
metadata.notes: Like the primary probe, this variant is intended only for safe detection. It should not execute OS-level commands, but it may generate 500 responses and associated logs on vulnerable endpoints.

props.name: request.body.text
props.value:
------PTKReact2ShellBoundary
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="1"

{}
------PTKReact2ShellBoundary
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="0"

["$1:a:a"]
------PTKReact2ShellBoundary--

metadata.description:
Microsoft Windows 'HTTP.sys' - Remote Code Execution

HTTP.sys in Microsoft Windows 7 SP1, Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, and Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted HTTP requests, aka "HTTP.sys Remote Code Execution Vulnerability."
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.

regex: The\ requested\ range\ is\ not\ satisfiable

metadata.description:
ThinkPHP 5.0.23 - Remote Code Execution

An issue was discovered in NoneCms V1.3. thinkphp/library/think/App.php allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via crafted use of the filter parameter, as demonstrated by the s=index/\think\Request/input&filter=phpinfo&data=1 query string.
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.

metadata.description:
WordPress Google Maps <7.11.18 - SQL Injection

WordPress Google Maps plugin before 7.11.18 contains a SQL injection vulnerability. The plugin includes /class.rest-api.php in the REST API and does not sanitize field names before a SELECT statement. An attacker can possibly obtain sensitive information from a database, modify data, and execute unauthorized administrative operations in the context of the affected site.
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.

metadata.description:
WordPress PayPal Pro <1.1.65 - SQL Injection

WordPress PayPal Pro plugin before 1.1.65 is susceptible to SQL injection via the 'query' parameter which allows for any unauthenticated user to perform SQL queries with the results output to a web page in JSON format.
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.

metadata.description:
Apache Struts 2.0.0-2.5.25 - Remote Code Execution

Apache Struts 2.0.0 through Struts 2.5.25 is susceptible to remote code execution because forced OGNL evaluation, when evaluated on raw user input in tag attributes, may allow it.
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.

modules.name: Netmask NPM Package - Server-Side Request Forgery (CVE-2021-28918)

metadata.description:
Netmask NPM Package - Server-Side Request Forgery

Netmask NPM Package is susceptible to server-side request forgery because of improper input validation of octal strings in netmask npm package. This allows unauthenticated remote attackers to perform indeterminate SSRF, remote file inclusion, and local file inclusion attacks on many of the dependent packages. A remote unauthenticated attacker can bypass packages relying on netmask to filter IPs and reach critical VPN or LAN hosts.
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.

metadata.description:
Thinkphp Lang - Local File Inclusion

ThinkPHP Framework before 6.0.14 allows local file inclusion via the lang parameter when the language pack feature is enabled (lang_switch_on=true). An unauthenticated and remote attacker can exploit this to execute arbitrary operating system commands, as demonstrated by including pearcmd.php.
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.

metadata.description:
Gibbon v25.0.0 - Local File Inclusion

Gibbon v25.0.0 is vulnerable to a Local File Inclusion (LFI) vulnerability where it's possible to include the content of several files present in the installation folder in the server's response.
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.

modules.name: Hotel Booking Lite < 4.8.5 - Arbitrary File Download & Deletion (CVE-2023-5991)

metadata.description:
Hotel Booking Lite < 4.8.5 - Arbitrary File Download & Deletion

The Hotel Booking Lite WordPress plugin before 4.8.5 does not validate file paths provided via user input, as well as does not have proper CSRF and authorisation checks, allowing unauthenticated users to download and delete arbitrary files on the server
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.

modules.name: WordPress Automatic Plugin <3.92.1 - Arbitrary File Download and SSRF (CVE-2022-1970)

metadata.description:
WordPress Automatic Plugin <3.92.1 - Arbitrary File Download and SSRF

WordPress Automatic plugin <3.92.1 is vulnerable to unauthenticated Arbitrary File Download and SSRF Located in the downloader.php file, could permit attackers to download any file from a site. Sensitive data, including login credentials and backup files, could fall into the wrong hands. This vulnerability has been patched in version 3.92.1.
metadata.recommendation: Use the PTK proof to verify impact, then patch/upgrade to a fixed version per vendor advisory. Apply compensating controls (WAF rules, access restrictions) where patching is not immediate.
